decision_conditions: Time Limit - 3 years
The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Approved Plans
The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s)

225-PL-01; 225-PL-02; 225-PL-03; 225-PL-04; 225-BR-06; Letter from Ealing Council's Children and Adult Services, dated 28th April 2015; Travel Plan, dated March 2015; Jubilee Children's Centre Weekly Timetable: Numbers of staff, Children and Parents.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | Revised Travel Plan

A Revised Travel Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 6 months of the date of approval of this application. The details submitted shall be designed to manage the transport needs of the centre's staff, pupils, parents and visitors, in order to demonstrate a car restraint policy for the site, minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport. This should include a drop off strategy for those travelling to the site by car. The approved scheme shall be implemented and retained for the life of the development.

Reason: To promote the use of modes of transport, other than use of private motor vehicles, in pursuance of the Council's policies on sustainability in accordance with the London Plan (2021) policy T6, the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document Sustainable Transport for New Development (2013) and policy 1.1 (f) of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012). | Temporary Permission

The single storey temporary children's centre, buggy store, shed and associated landscaping and boundary treatment works hereby approved is permitted until 1st June 2027 or upon the replacement centre forming part of the Green Man Lane regeneration scheme first being ready for occupation, whichever is the sooner, whereupon the whole development hereby approved shall cease and the buildings, ramps, steps, boundary treatment and associated paraphernalia shall be removed from the site with the land restored to its former condition as a grassed area.

Reason: The building and associated works, due to their nature, location and appearance are considered unsuitable for permanent retention in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with policy 7.4 and policy 7B of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy D4 of the London Plan (2021).
| Cycle and Scooter Parking

Within 6 months of the approval of this application 3 no. scooter parking spaces and 1 no. Sheffield bike stand (2 spaces) shall be installed on site and shall remain in place for the period of the temporary permission.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle and scooter parking is provided and retained in order to encourage the use of sustainable modes of transport and to reduce the reliance by pupils, staff and visitors travelling to children's centre by car in the interests of the conditions of general highway safety and the free flow of traffic on the neighbouring highway in accordance with policies T5 of the London Plan (2021), and policy 1.1 (f) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Insulation of Building Envelope

Within 6 months of the approval of this applicaiton details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect teaching and learning spaces from external noise. The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms. The works, as approved, shall be completed and retained for the period of the temporary permission.

Reason: To protect the occupiers of the building in accordance with policy 7A of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | External Plant

The rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

Reason: To protect the living and working conditions for the centre and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policy 7.15 of the adopted London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | Air Quality

Within 6 months of the approval this application,details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development complies with the air quality neutral building emissions benchmarks for the Class D1(c-h) use as stated in Appendix 5 of the Sustainable Design and Construction (2014) Supplementary Planning Guidance to the London Plan 2011 Implementation Framework.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not prejudice the environmental conditions of local residents and to meet policy SI 8 of the adopted London Plan (2021), policy 1.1(j) of the adopted Ealing Development Strategy (2012) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013). | Hours of Operation
The children and adult centre, hereby approved, shall operate only within the hours of 8:00-16:30 between Monday and Friday inclusive.

Reason: In the interest of the amenity of residential occupiers neighbouring the site, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013).
description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 7 (temporary approval for a 5 year period ending on 2nd June 2020) of planning permission ref: PP/2015/1288 dated 05/06/2015 for: Installation of temporary (5 years) modular single storey building for use as a nursery and an adult learning centre with associated buggy store, shed, landscaping and boundary treatment works (Deemed Consent)(Departure Application). Variation seeks to extend approval for existing temporary modular building by 7 years (from 2020 to 2027) to allow for the completion of the permanent childrens centre at the Green Man Lane development )(Regulation 3 Councils own development)
